nodes.bodyText: I think this is not necessary. This class is only used in our LongPollingActivateJobsHandler, since this is an actor it can make sure that this state is only accessed in this actor.
this should also be not necessary

This seems new right? Before we just blocked?
But do we still check the other brokers before we return to the client?
Yes, that is done internally in ActivateJobsHandler
So we just continue with sending requests?

Not exactly. We stop sending requests if

the failed attempts is greater than the threshold, or
all pending requests timed out

But as long as we are below the threshold for failed attempts and there are still request pending, we keep sending requests.

This would block the second request if the first request is in-flight even if there are plenty of jobs available in broker. Isn't it? Then we won't be able to process requests from multiple job workers concurrently.
You are so right. I focused so much on the edge case that I forgot the main case.
Isn't this again preventing concurrent requests?

I would like to have a refactoring of these chain of recursive calls it is really hard to understand and determine what is actually happening. Can we create an follow up issue which we can maybe prioritize.
Especially these boolean flags are always hard to understand I'm a fan of specific methods in these cases maybe it is possible to refactor them also then away.
